DOC.brief_summary: The Mobile Diabetes Intervention Study trial is evaluating a diabetes coaching system, using mobile phones and patient/ physician internet portals to allow patient-specific treatment and communication by their primary care physician. We hypothesize that timely information provided to patients and their physicians can result in reduction of A1c over 1 year.
DOC.criteria: Type 2 diabetic [patient] A1c equal to or greater than 7.5 [patient] 1864 years of age at time of recruitment [patient] Access to the internet (does not need to be at their home, elsewhere is fine e.g. work) [patient] Email account [patient] Must speak English [patient] No insulin pump [patient] No current alcohol or drug abuse must be sober 1 year [patient] Not currently pregnant [patient] No terminal diagnosis [patient] No dementia or Alzheimer's [patient] No active chemotherapy [patient] No significant hearing impairment [patient] Poorly corrected vision that would impede use of phone [patient] No mute or aphasia [patient] No diagnosis of schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, or major psychosis [patient] No Medicaid or Medicare No uninsured
